Title: Investor Awareness Program for Financial Literacy and Commodity Market Awareness
Description: The Investor Awareness Program for Financial Literacy and Commodity Market Awareness, held on 11th November 2025, aims to equip participants with essential knowledge of financial planning, smart investing, and the commodity market. The session is led by Mr. Aashish Shah, a reputed finance professional and experienced trainer known for his expertise in financial markets. The program is designed to enhance financial awareness and help attendees make informed financial decisions.

Title: One-Day Workshop on “Innovative Applications of UAV and GIS Technology for Civil Engineering Projects”
Description: The Department of Civil Engineering organized a One-Day Workshop on “Innovative Applications of UAV and GIS Technology for Civil Engineering Projects”. The workshop aimed to expose students and faculty members to the latest technological advancements in the use of Unmanned Aerial Vehicles (UAVs) and Geographic Information Systems (GIS) in the field of Civil Engineering. The event featured three expert talk sessions delivered by distinguished speakers covering topics from drone dynamics to real-world applications in civil, architectural, and water projects.

Title: Student Organizations
Description: The campus hosts various student groups such as the National Service Scheme (NSS) and Fit India Group. These organizations coordinate numerous activities, including sports tournaments and cultural programs, promoting leadership and community involvement among students.

Title: Thalessemia Test Camp
Description: While specific details about thalassemia test camps at GEC Patan are not readily available, the college is known for its commitment to social welfare initiatives. Regular blood donation camps are organized on campus, reflecting the institution's dedication to community health and student awareness.

Title: Career Guidance Seminar
Description: The job study and business-related information provided. Also familiarize with government job portal. The 104 students were present and Feedback Obtained. The seminar aims to provide engineering students with a clear roadmap for their careers, helping them explore opportunities in jobs, higher studies, and entrepreneurship. The session will guide students in choosing the right career path based on their skills, interests, and market trends

Title: Mock interviews
Description: The National Service Scheme (NSS) is an Indian government-sponsored public service program conducted by the Department of Youth Affairs and Sports of the Government of India. Popularly known as NSS, the scheme was launched in Gandhiji's Centenary year, 1969. Aimed at developing student's personality through community service, NSS is a voluntary association of young people in Colleges, Universities and at +2 level working for a campus-community linkage.

Title: Career Guidance  & Counseling
Description: No. of students present:110 (Electrical-32, Mech-37, Civil-41) The seminar aims to provide engineering students with a clear roadmap for their careers, helping them explore opportunities in jobs, higher studies, and entrepreneurship. The session will guide students in choosing the right career path based on their skills, interests, and market trends.

Title: Career Guidance Awareness
Description: The job study and business-related information provided. Also familiarize with government job portal. The 51 students were present and Feedback Obtained.

Title: Career Guidance  & Counseling for 6th sem EE/Mechanical Students
Description: The job study and business-related information provided. Also familiarize with government job portal. The 51 students were present and Feedback Obtained. The seminar aims to provide engineering students with a clear roadmap for their careers, helping them explore opportunities in jobs, higher studies, and entrepreneurship. The session will guide students in choosing the right career path based on their skills, interests, and market trends.

Title: Entrepreneurship after Engineering
Description: An Entrepreneurship after Engineering seminar is designed to aspiring students about entrepreneurs, and professionals to the fundamentals of entrepreneurship. It aims to develop an entrepreneurial mindset, provide insights into the startup ecosystem, and encourage innovation and self-employment. Also inform students about Government initiatives.

Title: Career Guidance Seminar
Description: The job study and business-related information provided. Also familiarize with government job portal. The 51 students were present and Feedback Obtained.

Title: Entrepreneurship Awareness Seminar
Description: An Entrepreneurship Awareness seminar is designed to introduce students, aspiring entrepreneurs, and professionals to the fundamentals of entrepreneurship. It aims to develop an entrepreneurial mindset, provide insights into the startup ecosystem, and encourage innovation and self-employment. Also inform students about Government initiatives.

Title: Alumni Meet 2022
Description: GEC Patan organized its Alumni Meet 2022, reuniting graduates from various batches to rekindle memories and strengthen professional networks. The event included interactive sessions, sharing of experiences, and cultural programs.

Title: Alumni Meet 2024
Description: The Alumni Meet 2024 at GEC Patan, graced by Chief Guest Dr. H. S. Patel, celebrated lasting bonds and achievements. Highlights included industry discussions, student-alumni interactions, alumni felicitations, and cultural events. The event fostered connection, inspiration, and pride among graduates, students, and faculty, strengthening the GEC Patan community spirit.

Title: Alumni Meet 2025
Description: The Alumni Meet 2025 at GEC Patan, graced by Chief Guest Dr. K. B. Judal, Principal of GEC Palanpur, focused on connecting alumni across generations. With career mentorship, startup showcases, and tech talks, the event strengthened alumni-institute ties and inspired students through valuable real-world insights and experiences.

Title: PRAGATI 2025
Description: PRAGATI 2025, the grand annual cultural fest of GEC Patan, was celebrated with unmatched enthusiasm on 5th April 2025. Featuring vibrant performances, student honors, and a tribute to Indian heritage, the event symbolized unity, talent, and tradition—making it a memorable evening for students, faculty, and alumni alike.

Title: THANGHANAAT 2024
Description: Thanghanaat 2024 lit up the GEC Patan campus with colors, beats, and unstoppable energy! Held on 9th March, this grand Navratri celebration by the Gymkhana Cultural Committee brought students together in dazzling traditional attire for a night of Garba, joy, and cultural unity. Truly, an unforgettable evening of dance and celebration!

Title: Personal Development Training Camp 2024
Description: Personality Development Camp 2024, organized by GTU from 18th to 21st July at Somnath Sanskrit University, offered GEC Patan students a transformative experience. Through leadership sessions, cultural exchanges, spiritual insights, and talent showcases, the camp nurtured confidence, creativity, and values—shaping future-ready individuals with purpose and positivity.

Title: Basic Rock Climbing Camp 2024
Description: Basic Rock Climbing Camp 2024, held at SVIM Mount Abu from 16th–25th November, empowered GEC Patan students through adventure and discipline. Organized by GTU, the camp featured expert-led training in trekking, climbing, and survival skills—fostering physical fitness, confidence, and resilience through real-world challenges and team spirit.

Title: THANGHANAAT 2023
Description: Thanghanaat 2023, GEC Patan’s spirited Navratri celebration, was held on 16th October with energetic Garba, Dandiya, and a soulful Aarti. Students and faculty in traditional attire danced in unity, filling the campus with joy, devotion, and cultural pride—creating a memorable evening of festivity, faith, and togetherness.

Title: Personality Development Training Camp 2023
Description: Personality Development Camp 2023, organized by GTU at Somnath Sanskrit University from 7th–10th May, empowered selected GEC Patan students through expert-led sessions on leadership, communication, and career skills. The camp fostered confidence, personal growth, and clarity of purpose—leaving a lasting impact on participants' academic and professional journeys.

Title: Drama Training Camp 2023
Description: Drama Training Camp 2023, organized by GTU from 11th–17th May at Somnath Sanskrit University, gave GEC Patan students immersive exposure to acting, stagecraft, and expression. With expert mentorship and live performances, the camp boosted creativity, confidence, and cultural understanding—shaping students into expressive, confident, and collaborative performers.

Title: Lok Nritya Training Camp 2024
Description: Lok Nritya Training Camp 2024, held from 21st–27th July at Somnath Sanskrit University, celebrated Gujarat’s vibrant folk traditions. Four GEC Patan students mastered Garba, Raas, Hudo, and more under expert guidance. The camp nurtured cultural pride, artistic expression, and unity—earning praise for their authentic, energetic stage performances.

Title: Lok Nritya Training Camp 2023
Description: GEC Patan students participated in GTU’s Lok Nritya Training Camp 2023 from April 11–17 at Somnath Sanskrit University, Veraval. The camp offered immersive training in folk dances like Garba and Hudo. Students gained rhythm, stage skills, and deep cultural insights—honoring Gujarat’s rich traditions through joyful learning and vibrant performances.

Title: Career Guidance Seminar
Description: The Career Guidance Seminar provided students with insights into diverse career paths, higher education opportunities, and industry demands. Expert speakers offered guidance on career planning, competitive exams, and essential skills for professional success.

Title: Entrepreneurship Awareness Program
Description: The Entrepreneurship Awareness Program encouraged innovation and self-reliance among students. Participants learned about business startup processes, funding opportunities, and entrepreneurial success stories from industry experts and startup founders.

Title: Mock Interview
Description: The Mock Interview sessions simulated real recruitment scenarios, helping students refine their communication, technical, and problem-solving skills. Constructive feedback from experts boosted their confidence for actual job interviews.

Title: Finishing School
Description: The Finishing School program focused on personality development, workplace etiquette, technical skills, and soft skills. It prepared students to transition smoothly from academic life to professional careers.

Title: Mega Placement Camp
Description: The Mega Placement Camp brought together multiple companies on a single platform, offering students a wide range of job opportunities. The event streamlined recruitment processes and increased placement prospects.

Title: Placement Drive
Description: The Placement Drive connected students with leading recruiters across various industries. It featured aptitude tests, group discussions, and interview rounds to facilitate campus hiring.

Title: On Campus Placement
Description: On Campus Placement activities invited recruiters directly to the college, allowing students to participate in interviews and selection processes without leaving the campus.

Title: Off-Campus Placement
Description: Off-Campus Placement opportunities connected students with companies recruiting outside the campus. The Placement Cell facilitated participation in these drives to expand career options.

Title: Civil Services Exam Seminar
Description: The Civil Services Exam Seminar guided students on UPSC and GPSC exam preparation strategies, eligibility criteria, and syllabus coverage. Experts shared valuable tips for success in competitive examinations.

Title: Technical Skill Workshop
Description: The Technical Skill Workshop enhanced students’ domain expertise through hands-on training in emerging technologies, programming languages, and industry tools, preparing them for technical job roles.

Title: SSIP 2.0 Sensitization Program in Civil
Description: The SSIP Cell of Government Engineering College, Patan, organized an SSIP 2.0 Sensitization Program for Civil Engineering students on 7th August 2025. Conducted by Dr. Hitesh Panchal, the session aimed to raise awareness about SSIP 2.0, including its objectives, eligibility, PoC preparation, design thinking, and IPR processes. Over 71 students participated, engaging in discussions on innovation, funding, and team building. The program effectively motivated students to develop innovative solutions, strengthening the college’s innovation ecosystem and encouraging active participation in future SSIP activities.

Title: SSIP 2.0 Sensitization Program in CSE
Description: The SSIP Cell of Government Engineering College, Patan, conducted an SSIP 2.0 Sensitization Program for Computer Science and Engineering students on 5th August 2025. Led by Prof. Harshad L. Chaudhary, the session introduced SSIP 2.0’s vision, objectives, PoC submission process, design thinking, and IPR guidelines. Over 75 students participated actively, engaging in discussions on innovation, funding, and patenting. The program effectively motivated students to transform their ideas into impactful projects, strengthening the innovation culture within the department.

Title: SSIP 2.0 Sensitization Program
Description: The SSIP Cell of Government Engineering College, Patan, organized an SSIP 2.0 Sensitization Program for Electrical Engineering students on 1st August 2025. Conducted by Dr. Hitesh Panchal, the session aimed to raise awareness about the Student Startup and Innovation Policy (SSIP) 2.0, covering its objectives, eligibility, PoC preparation, design thinking, and IPR processes. Over 63 students participated, engaging in discussions on innovation, funding, and team building. The event inspired students to develop innovative solutions and strengthened the college’s innovation ecosystem.

Title: SSIP 2.0 Sensitization Program in EC
Description: The SSIP Cell of Government Engineering College, Patan, organized an SSIP 2.0 Sensitization Program for Electronics and Communication Engineering students on 31st July 2025. Conducted by Dr. Hitesh Panchal, the session aimed to raise awareness about SSIP 2.0, covering its objectives, eligibility, PoC preparation, design thinking, and IPR processes. Over 90 students participated, engaging in discussions on innovation, funding, and team building. The event successfully inspired students to pursue innovative solutions and strengthened the college’s innovation ecosystem.

Title: PoC Presentation 2.0
Description: The SSIP Cell of Government Engineering College, Patan, organized PoC Presentation 2.0 on 30th July 2025 to showcase innovative student projects from the Mechanical Engineering Department. Five groups presented their Proof of Concept ideas, focusing on practical, scalable solutions in areas like energy optimization, automation, and sustainable systems. Evaluated by industry experts, the event encouraged innovation, provided valuable feedback, and approved funding of ₹3,00,000 for selected projects under SSIP 2.0, fostering a culture of problem-solving and entrepreneurship among students.

Title: SSIP 2.0 sensitization program
Description: The SSIP 2.0 Sensitization Program aims to create COMMITTEE DETAILS awareness among students, faculty, and stakeholders about the Student Startup and Innovation Policy (SSIP) 2.0. This initiative enhances the innovation ecosystem by providing financial, technical, and mentorship support for student-led projects, startups, and research. The program educates participants about funding opportunities, prototyping assistance, and industry collaborations. It also highlights advancements from SSIP 1.0, focusing on scalability, intellectual property rights (IPR), and commercialization. Through workshops, seminars, and interactive sessions, the sensitization program encourages students to actively participate in innovation and entrepreneurship, driving technological progress and self-reliance in Gujarat and beyond. 120 students of First year including all branches have participated in it.

Title: Manushya Gaurav Diwas 2025 Celebration
Description: Celebrating the essence of human dignity and universal brotherhood, we observed 'Manushya Gaurav Diwas 2025' via a virtual gathering on Google Meet. The session focused on the philosophy of the 'Indwelling God,' encouraging participants to recognize the divine within themselves and others. Despite the digital medium, the event fostered a strong sense of unity and spiritual introspection among all attendees.

Title: International Happiness Day Celebration
Description: In celebration of International Happiness Day 2025, we organized vibrant group discussions to explore the multifaceted nature of joy and well-being. Participants engaged in meaningful dialogue regarding mental health, positive psychology, and the art of finding happiness in daily life. The interactive sessions fostered a sense of community, allowing individuals to share personal insights and collective strategies for a more fulfilling life.

Title: Manushya Gaurav Diwas 2024 Celebration
Description: Commemorating the profound spirit of human dignity, 'Manushya Gaurav Diwas 2024' was celebrated with great enthusiasm at the Electrical Seminar Hall. The event brought together students and faculty to reflect on the values of self-respect, universal brotherhood, and the divine potential within every individual. Through inspiring speeches and interactive sessions, the gathering reinforced the importance of uplifting society through mutual respect and spiritual oneness.

Title: GPSC-UPSC Exam Awareness Event Report-2025-26
Description: Awareness & Preparation Strategy for UPSC and GPSC Examinations conducted by Training & Placement Cell, Government Engineering College, Patan.
TargetStudents: Pre final & Final Year - All Branch

Title: An industrial visit was organized at BISAG, Gandhinagar, to provide practical exposure to students of Semester V and Semester VII.
Description: An Industrial Visit to BISAG-N was organized on 14 October 2025 for EC students to provide industry exposure in advanced communication technologies. Students learned about satellite communication, GIS, remote sensing, and live broadcasting systems through expert interactions and demonstrations. The visit helped students relate theoretical concepts to real-world applications and enhanced their understanding of government-level ICT, geospatial technologies, and emerging digital solutions.

Title: Bridging Theory and Practice: EC Students Showcase Innovation at Project Presentation 2025
Description: A Project Presentation was organized on 25 November 2025 for second-year EC students to strengthen practical learning and innovation. Students presented mini projects using hardware models, breadboard circuits, and software demonstrations, explaining design, working principles, and applications. Faculty members evaluated projects through interactions and technical discussions. The activity enhanced problem-solving ability, teamwork, technical communication skills, and supported outcome-based education and continuous assessment practices.

Title: Poster presentation activity was arranged for students of semester 3 of Electronics and communication engineering branch on 25th november to enhance their presentation and technical skills.
Description: A Poster Presentation on Network Theory was organized on 25 November 2025 for Semester III ECE students. Participants presented key syllabus concepts using posters and engaged in discussions with faculty, enhancing conceptual understanding, technical communication, and presentation skills as part of continuous course assessment.

Title: THANGHANAAT 2025
Description: Thanghanaat 2025 lit up the GEC Patan campus with colors, beats, and unstoppable energy! Held on 9th March, this grand Navratri celebration by the Gymkhana Cultural Committee brought students together in dazzling traditional attire for a night of Garba, joy, and cultural unity. Truly, an unforgettable evening of dance and celebration!

Title: Music Training Camp 2025
Description: The Music Training Camp 2025, organized by GTU, provided students of GEC Patan an enriching opportunity to explore Gujarati Lokgeet and traditional music. Held at Somnath Sanskrit University, the camp focused on vocal techniques, rhythm, expression, and cultural heritage, nurturing musical talent and cultural pride.

Title: Personality Development Training Camp 2025
Description: The Personality Development Training Camp 2025 aimed at enhancing leadership, communication, and confidence among students. Conducted at Somnath Sanskrit University, the camp included youth parliament sessions, expert talks, team activities, and field visits, fostering holistic personal and professional growth.

Title: Drama Training Camp 2025
Description: The Drama Training Camp 2025 offered GEC Patan students intensive exposure to theatre and acting. Organized by GTU, the camp emphasized acting fundamentals, voice modulation, stage presence, and character building under expert guidance, boosting creativity, confidence, and artistic expression.

Title: Lok Nritya Training Camp 2025
Description: The Lok Nritya Training Camp 2025 immersed students in Gujarat’s rich folk dance traditions. Held at Somnath Sanskrit University, the camp covered Garba, Raas, Tippani, and other folk forms, focusing on rhythm, expression, teamwork, and cultural understanding through expert-led workshops and performances.

Title: Women Health and Hygiene Seminar 2025
Description: The Women Development Cell organized a seminar on Women Health and Hygiene to create awareness about menstrual health, hygiene practices, and reproductive well-being. The session provided a safe space for students to discuss menstruation, PCOD/PCOS, and health management, promoting informed and stigma-free conversations.

Title: Women Health Awareness & Open Discussion
Description: The Women Health Awareness and Open Discussion program focused on educating women about gynecological health, preventive care, cancer awareness, and mental well-being. Led by a medical expert, the interactive session encouraged open dialogue, addressed myths, and empowered participants to prioritize their health.

Title: Talk Show on Lakhpati Didi
Description: As part of Viksit Bharat Week, the Women Development Cell organized a Talk Show on the Lakhpati Didi initiative. The session highlighted women empowerment through government schemes and featured an inspiring real-life journey, motivating students towards entrepreneurship, innovation, and financial independence.

Title: International Women’s Day Celebration
Description: The International Women’s Day Celebration was organized to honor women’s achievements and promote gender equality. Through motivational talks, cultural activities, and student-led programs, the event fostered confidence, leadership, and awareness about the vital role of women in society.

Title: Women Entrepreneurship and Self Development
Description: This seminar aimed to inspire women towards entrepreneurship and self-development by building confidence, leadership, and innovative thinking. Participants learned about government schemes, entrepreneurial skills, and real-world strategies to transform ideas into impactful ventures.

Title: Breast Cancer Diagnosis and Awareness
Description: The Breast Cancer Awareness program focused on early detection, self-examination, and breaking myths related to breast cancer. The seminar empowered students with practical knowledge, emphasized preventive healthcare, and encouraged them to spread awareness within their communities.

Title: Domestic Violence Act 2005 Awareness & SHE Team Session
Description: An awareness program was conducted on the Domestic Violence Act, 2005, along with information on SHE Team services and the 181 Abhayam Helpline. The session educated students about legal rights, safety mechanisms, and emergency support systems for women.

Title: HIV Awareness Program
Description: The HIV Awareness Program aimed to educate students about HIV/AIDS, its prevention, symptoms, and social stigma. Experts shared medical insights and real-life experiences, promoting empathy, responsible behavior, and preventive health practices among students.

Title: Mental Health Awareness Seminar
Description: The Psychology Cell of GEC Patan, in collaboration with NSS, organized a Mental Health Awareness Seminar to promote emotional well-being and mental resilience among students. The session focused on stress management, self-awareness, emotional balance, and the importance of seeking help, encouraging open conversations around mental health.

Title: National Youth Day – Swami Vivekananda Jayanti
Description: On the occasion of National Youth Day, a special session was conducted to commemorate Swami Vivekananda Jayanti. The programme emphasized youth empowerment, character building, self-confidence, and leadership, inspiring students to adopt Swami Vivekananda’s ideals in their personal and professional lives.

Files.Title: National Youth Day – Swami Vivekananda Jayanti

Title: GDG on Campus Orientation Session
Description: Google Developer Groups(GDG) intro session started with our mentor Khushali Raval welcoming everyone and talking about why joining developer communities matters. The core team then showed how big GDG is worldwide and how students of G.E.C. Patan can tap into tech-related activities. We talked about building connections with industry professionals and other tech-loving students. We were introduced to some helpful Google tools. The session concluded with students asking lots of questions about GDG activities and technical skills. The whole event got first-year students excited to become a part of our GDG family.

Title: Unlocking the Future with Machine Learning
Description: Mr. Sumit Chawla led an AI/ML workshop which was organised in collaboration with four universities-ITM SLS Baroda University, Karnavati University, Marwadi University, and Birla Vishwakarma University. AI/ML fundamentals with their real-world applications were introduced. The session emphasized the importance of hands-on experience and practical implementation. Career opportunities, skill development strategies and open-source contributions were also discussed. The workshop concluded with an interactive Q&A session that offered expert insights to participants.

Title: Basics of Git-Github & Linux
Description: The workshop on Basics of Git, GitHub, and Linux by Kuber Jaydeep at GDG on campus covered Git commands like git init, git add, git commit, git push, and git pull for version control and branching. It explained GitHub’s role in storing and collaborating on code through pull requests and branch management. The Linux section covered basic commands like ls, cd, mkdir, rm, and chmod, along with package management using apt-get and text editing with nano and vim. The workshop highlighted how Git, GitHub, and Linux streamline development and collaboration.

Title: Tech Winter Break
Description: The workshop on Web Development conducted by Yogesh Vasisth at GDG on campus covered the basics of building websites and web applications. It introduced HTML for structuring web pages, CSS for styling, and JavaScript for adding interactivity. Key concepts like responsive design, the DOM (Document Object Model), and event handling were discussed. The session also touched on modern frameworks and libraries like React for building dynamic user interfaces and managing state. Best practices for performance optimization, accessibility, and cross-browser compatibility were highlighted, providing a solid foundation for developing modern web applications.

Title: Introduction to Robotics
Description: The workshop on Introduction to Robotics conducted by Krish Patel at GDG on campus covered the fundamental concepts of robotics, including the design, programming, and control of robots. It introduced key components such as sensors, actuators, and microcontrollers, explaining how they work together to enable robotic movement and interaction with the environment. The session discussed different types of robots, including autonomous and remote-controlled models, and explored programming techniques used to control robotic behavior. Practical examples and demonstrations helped illustrate how to build and program simple robots, providing a solid foundation for further exploration in the field of robotics.

Title: Dive into Java Development
Description: The 2-day Java Bootcamp conducted by Kunal Awasthi at GDG on campus covered the fundamentals of Java programming, focusing on both theory and practical applications. It started with the basics of Java syntax, data types, and control structures, followed by object-oriented programming (OOP) concepts like classes, objects, inheritance, polymorphism, and encapsulation. The bootcamp also introduced exception handling, file handling, and Java collections such as lists, sets, and maps. Participants worked on hands-on coding exercises and small projects to reinforce their understanding. The session concluded with best practices for writing efficient Java code and tips for solving common programming challenges.

Title: Inaugural Function of VLSI Club
Description: The Electronics and Communication Engineering Department of Government Engineering College, Patan organized the VLSI Club Opening Ceremony on 15th October 2025. The event began with the formal inauguration of the club by Principal Dr. B. J. Shah, along with Dr. A. B. Dhruv (Professor, Mechanical Engineering) and Dr. D. H. Patel (Head of the Electronics and Communication Engineering Department). The VLSI Club was established with the objective of strengthening students’ technical competencies in the field of Very Large-Scale Integration (VLSI). The Faculty Coordinator, Prof. M. L. Patel, addressed the gathering and presented the vision, mission, and scope of the VLSI Club. During the session, the importance of VLSI technology in modern electronics was highlighted, especially its applications in semiconductor chip design, embedded systems, Artificial Intelligence hardware, and the Internet of Things (IoT).

Title: Sanchar Saathi Seminar
Description: The Electronics and Communication Engineering Department of Government Engineering College, Patan organized a seminar on “Sanchar Saathi – A Citizen-Centric Telecom Security Initiative” on 21/01/2026 to spread awareness about telecom security and digital safety among students. The seminar focused on introducing the Sanchar Saathi portal and mobile application launched by the Department of Telecommunications (DoT), Government of India. The key objectives of the initiative, including protecting citizens from telecom fraud, improving transparency in mobile connections, and promoting responsible digital practices, were explained in detail. During the session, important services such as Chakshu for reporting fraudulent calls and messages, blocking lost or stolen mobile phones using IMEI numbers, verifying mobile connections, and identifying suspicious international calls were discussed. Students were also guided on how to access and use these services through the web portal and mobile application. The seminar emphasized the role of citizens in maintaining a secure telecom ecosystem by actively reporting suspicious activities and staying informed about digital threats. The event concluded with enthusiastic student participation and a positive response, making the session informative and impactful.

Title: Sanchar Saathi Seminar
Description: A seminar on “Sanchar Saathi – A Citizen-Centric Telecom Security Initiative” was conducted for Semester 3 students of the Electronics and Communication Engineering Department to promote awareness about telecom security and digital safety. The session focused on educating students about cyber threats, telecom fraud, and responsible mobile usage. Students were introduced to the Sanchar Saathi portal and mobile application launched by the Department of Telecommunications (DoT), Government of India. Key services such as reporting fraud through Chakshu, blocking lost or stolen mobile phones using IMEI numbers, verifying SIM connections, and identifying suspicious calls were explained using practical examples. The seminar encouraged students to stay alert, adopt safe digital practices, and actively contribute to preventing telecom fraud. The session received positive participation and helped strengthen students’ understanding of cybersecurity and telecom safety.

Title: Sanchar Saathi Seminar
Description: An awareness program on Sanchar Saathi – a citizen-centric telecom security initiative was conducted at Katpur Village on the Patan–Mehsana Highway to educate village elders and youngsters about cybersecurity and telecom safety. The program focused on creating awareness about digital fraud, safe mobile usage, and the importance of protecting personal information. Participants were introduced to the Sanchar Saathi portal and mobile application launched by the Department of Telecommunications (DoT), Government of India. Key services such as reporting fraud through Chakshu, blocking lost or stolen mobile phones using IMEI numbers, verifying SIM connections, and identifying suspicious calls were explained in simple and practical terms. The session encouraged villagers to remain alert, report suspicious activities, and adopt responsible digital practices. The initiative received positive participation from the community and contributed to improving cybersecurity awareness in the rural area.

Title: MOOC Sensitization And Registration (EC)
Description: The Electronics and Communication Engineering Department organized a sensitization and registration program on 19th January 2026 for every-year students to highlight the importance and benefits of Massive Open Online Courses (MOOCs). The program aimed to familiarize students with various online learning platforms and resources available for enhancing their academic and professional skills. Dr. Haresh Judal delivered a presentation on the Guidelines for Implementation of MOOCs w.e.f. Academic Year 2025–26 as published by GTU, while Prof. Roshni Chaudhari discussed the list of MOOC and GTU-offered courses available for students of different engineering branches.

Title: The inauguration ceremony of the code hives club
Description: The inauguration ceremony of the Code Hives Club showcased the great vision and dedication of Mr. Het Chauhan and his team, who worked tirelessly to turn this idea into reality. The support and mentorship provided by Prof. Sachin Makwana and Prof. Jay Patel played a pivotal role in establishing the club. Moreover, the unwavering support and encouragement from the Head of the Department, Dr. Hari Krishna Jethva, along with his vision and belief in the potential of the club, ensured that it received the necessary resources and guidance.

Title: Introduction to Git and GitHub
Description: On 17 September 2022, the Code Hives (GitHub Club) of GEC Patan organized an online webinar on Introduction to Git and GitHub with over 130 participants. Mr. Jignesh explained the basics of Git, GitHub, SDLC, version control, and code conflicts through live demonstrations. The session concluded with an interactive question-and-answer session followed by a vote of thanks by the Head of the Department and faculty members.

Title: Glance at Web Designing
Description: On 30 September 2022, the Code Hives (GitHub Club) of GEC Patan organized a Web Designing workshop at the CSE Department Seminar Hall for 65 selected students. Mr. Aditya Patel covered the basics of HTML and CSS, including important tags, shortcuts, debugging techniques, and layout concepts through live practical sessions and a demo project. The workshop also included interactive doubt-solving, a brunch break, the announcement of the new club coordinator, and concluded with valuable student feedback.

Title: Dive into Docker
Description: This event was organized by the Code Hives Club under the leadership of Ms. Ashvi Patel, with mentorship from Prof. Sachin Makwana and Prof. Jay Patel. The firm support and guidance of the Head of the Department, Dr. Hari Krishna Jethva, contributed significantly to creating an inspiring and impactful experience.

Title: Essential To Data science.
Description: The Code Hives Club organized an incredible event under the leadership of Ms. Ashvi Patel and her team. With the guidance and mentorship of Prof. Sachin Makwana, Prof. Jay Patel, and the visionary leadership of the Head of the Department, Dr. Hari Krishna Jethva, the event was conducted successfully and left a lasting impact.

Title: Fundamentals of QA Engineering
Description: This event was successfully arranged by the Code Hives Club under the leadership of Ms. Ashvi Patel and her team. The event was guided by Prof. Sachin Makwana and Prof. Jay Patel, with constant support and encouragement from the Head of the Department, Dr. Harikrishna Jethva.

Title: Data Visualization with Tableau
Description: On 8 November 2023, the Code Hives (GitHub Club) of GEC Patan organized an online webinar on Data Visualization using Tableau with participation from over 90 students. The session was conducted by Ms. Rama M. Maliya, who explained the fundamentals of data visualization and Tableau, guided students through the installation and account setup process, and covered topics such as data labeling, sorting, dashboard creation, and story development. The webinar concluded with an interactive question-and-answer session followed by a vote of thanks by the host.

Title: Debate competition
Description: This event was organized by the Code Hives Club under the leadership of Ms. Ashvi Patel, with mentorship from Prof. Sachin Makwana and Prof. Jay Patel. The firm support and guidance provided by the Head of the Department, Dr. Harikrishna Jethva, helped create an inspiring and impactful experience.

Title: FlutterFever Workshop
Description: On the evening of 23 December 2023, the Code Hives (GitHub Club) of GEC Patan organized an enlightening workshop titled "FlutterFever." The primary objective of the workshop was to provide students with comprehensive insights into Flutter, a versatile framework for modern application development. The session was conducted on the Google Meet platform and featured Mr. Cavin Macwan as the distinguished speaker.

Title: Post by Postman API
Description: The event witnessed active student participation and began with a warm welcome by the organizers. Mr. Achintya Singh delivered an informative session on Postman API, covering its fundamentals, installation process, advanced features, and practical applications in API testing and team collaboration. The session concluded with an interactive question-and-answer segment followed by a vote of thanks to the speaker.

Title: Bharat Vikas Yatra
Description: In observance of World Mental Health Day during the global Mental Health Month of October, a two-day Bharat Vikas Yatra was organized on 10th and 11th October 2024. The program was conducted under the visionary leadership and active presence of the Principal, Dr. Bharat J. Shah, with the objective of promoting holistic well-being within the academic community. Recognizing the strong connection between mental health, environment, and cultural heritage, the excursion offered a valuable mental refreshment for staff members and students from various departments. The initiative moved beyond the traditional classroom setting and helped foster a culture of wellness and collective belonging.

Title: VIBRANT GUJARAT
Description: In celebration of World Mental Health Day during the global Mental Health Month of October 2025, the college participated in the high-profile Vibrant Gujarat Regional Conference hosted at Ganpat University, Mehsana. Organized by the Government of Gujarat, the three-day event served as a significant platform for academic and professional development. Under the visionary leadership and active presence of the Principal, students and staff members from all departments attended the conference and actively engaged in state-level initiatives and expert-led discussions.

Title: MOOC Sensitization And Registration (EE)
Description: The Electrical Engineering department organized a sensitization and registration program to create awareness among students about the significance of Massive Open Online Courses (MOOCs). The initiative focused on informing students about the benefits of online learning and the wide range of digital platforms and courses available to support their academic growth and skill development. The program included sessions on institutional guidelines for MOOC implementation and an overview of approved and recommended online courses offered by the university for various engineering disciplines, helping students understand enrollment procedures and course selection.
